SEARCH
Module org.klojang.jdbc
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class BatchQuery<T>

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.BatchQuery<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the JavaBeans or records produced by the BatchQuery.
public final class BatchQuery<T> extends Object
Enables you to process a query result in batches across multiple, independent requests. These would typically be HTTP requests, but any stateless request-response mechanism might want to use the functionality offered by the BatchInsert class. The query result will be kept alive until all records have been extracted from it. Once all records have been extracted, the associated JDBC resources will be closed automatically. As soon as, and as long as there are any such persistent query results, a background thread will periodically check whether any of them have gone stale. Stale query results will be closed and disposed of by this thread.

  • Constructor Details

    • BatchQuery

      public BatchQuery(BatchQuery.QueryId queryId, ExtractorFactory<T> factory)
      Instantiates a new BatchQuery object.
      Parameters:
      queryId - the ID of the query result to be processed by the BatchQuery object
      factory - a factory for the BeanExtractor that will process the ResultSet

  • Method Details

    • register

      public static BatchQuery.QueryId register(SQLQuery query)
      Registers the specified SQLQuery for batch processing and returns a QueryId. The QueryId can be used to instantiate a BatchInsert object, allowing it the identify and wrap itself around a ResultSet. Equivalent to register(query, Duration.ofMinutes(10), true). In other words, the client gets ten minutes to process a batch before it must request the next batch. After that, the ResultSet will be deemed stale. It will be closed and disposed of, and the request will trigger a DatabaseException.
      Parameters:
      query - the SQLQuery to be registered for batch processing
      Returns:
      a QueryId

    • register

      public static BatchQuery.QueryId register(SQLQuery query, Duration stayAliveTime)
      Registers the specified SQLQuery for batch processing and returns a QueryId. The QueryId can be used to instantiate a BatchInsert object, allowing it the identify and wrap itself around a ResultSet. Equivalent to register(query, stayAliveTime, true).
      Parameters:
      query - the SQLQuery to be registered for batch processing
      stayAliveTime - determines how long the query result should be kept alive between requests for new batches. If the time interval between any two consecutive requests is longer than the specified duration, the query result will be deemed stale and Klojang JDBC will close the associated JDBC resources and then dispose of it.
      Returns:
      a QueryId

    • register

      public static BatchQuery.QueryId register(SQLQuery query, Duration stayAliveTime, boolean closeConnection)
      Registers the specified SQLQuery for batch processing and returns a QueryId. The QueryId can be used to instantiate a BatchInsert object, allowing it the identify and wrap itself around a ResultSet.
      Parameters:
      query - the SQLQuery to be registered for batch processing
      stayAliveTime - determines how long the query result should be kept alive between requests for new batches. If the time interval between any two consecutive requests is longer than the specified duration, the query result will be deemed stale and Klojang JDBC will close the associated JDBC resources and then dispose of it.
      closeConnection - whether to close the JDBC connection once all records have been retrieved from the underlying ResultSet
      Returns:

    • terminateAll

      public static void terminateAll()
      Terminates the processing of all persistent query results.

    • nextBatch

      public List<T> nextBatch(int batchSize)
      Retrieves the next batch of records from the query result and converts them into instances of type <T>.
      Parameters:
      batchSize - the number of records to retrieve
      Returns:
      the next batch of records, converted into instances of type <T>

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Terminates the processing of the query result. Will close the underlying ResultSet and possibly also the associated JDBC connection (see register(SQLQuery, Duration, boolean)). You do not need to call this method if you process the query result all the way to the last row, but you might want to call this in exceptional situations where you need to abort the query.
